alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:09PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Carbon County through 300 PM MDT... At 208 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Teton Reservoir, or 13 miles southwest of Rawlins, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rawlins and Sinclair. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 200 and 218. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
